Rule.Name: sAccessPR
Rule.Title: The build number for Access.exe indicates a Private Release (PR) build and this is an unsupported configuration
Rule.Text: The build number for Access.exe '{0}' indicates a Private Release (PR) build. PR builds are intended only for testing and not production use. Please install the latest publicly available update.

Object.Key4: Name LIKE '%Office 14, Office%' AND ProductKeyID LIKE '%%PID%%'
Name LIKE '%Office 14, Office%' AND ProductKeyID LIKE '%%PID%%'

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerAccess
Rule.Title: An incompatible version of the PDFMaker add-in is installed
Rule.Text: You have a version of the PDFMaker add-in installed that is not compatible with Access. Please update the add-in to version 10 or higher. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerx64
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion>13 and ((substring($.,1,2)='10' and number(substring($.,4,1))<1) or substring($.,1,1)!='1') and $bitness='x64'
Rule.Title: Adobe PDFMaker detected on a client with 64-bit Office
Rule.Text: The Adobe PDFMaker add-in was found on a computer that also has a 64-bit install of Office. The PDFMaker add-in version you have is not supported with 64-bit versions of Office. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Name: sDisabledAddins
Rule.Title: Add-ins have been automatically disabled because of performance or stability issues
Rule.Text: Access add-ins have been disabled due to performance or stability issues. To see the list of disabled add-ins, click the Configuration Details tile (above) and then search for 'Disabled Add-ins' using the Find feature.

Rule.Name: sUserReenabledAddins
Rule.Title: Problematic add-in(s) re-enabled by the user
Rule.Text: {0} add-in(s) disabled by Access because of performance or stability issues was/were re-enabled by the user. To see the list of disabled add-ins that were re-enabled by the user, click the Configuration Details tile (above) and then search for 'DoNotDisableAddinList' using the Find feature.

Rule.Name: sHkcuVBAOff
Rule.Title: VBA functionality is impaired or disabled (HKCU registry data)
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value in the HKCU registry hive is set to a value other than 0. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Rule.Name: sHklmVBAOff
Rule.Title: Visual Basic for Applications is disabled (HKLM registry data)
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value = 1 in the registry under the HKLM hive. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Rule.Name: sAccessCurVer
Rule.Title: Incorrect Access registry data causes an alert to appear
Rule.Text: There is information in the registry that causes Access to display 'Setup is configuring Access' each time it is started.

Rule.Name: sBadACEDAORegWow
Rule.Title: Error using Access wizards due incorrect path for Acedao.dll in the registry
Rule.Text: To resolve this issue, you will need to update the TypeLib registration for ACEDAO.dll. Please use the '64-bit Windows, 32-bit Office' instructions in article 2019235.

Rule.Name: sBadACEDAOReg32
Rule.Title: Error using Access wizards due incorrect path for Acedao.dll in the registry
Rule.Text: To resolve this issue, you will need to update the TypeLib registration for ACEDAO.dll. Please use the instructions for '32-bit Windows, 32-bit Office' in article 2019235.

Rule.Name: sBadACEDAOReg64
Rule.Title: Error using Access wizards due incorrect path for Acedao.dll in the registry
Rule.Text: To resolve this issue, you will need to update the TypeLib registration for ACEDAO.dll. Please use the instructions for '64-bit Windows, 64-bit Office' in article 2019235.

Rule.Name: sBadACEDAO2013C2RReg
Rule.Title: Error using Access wizards due incorrect path for Acedao.dll in the registry
Rule.Text: To resolve this issue, update the TypeLib registration for Acedao.dll. Please use the '(32-bit Windows, 32-bit Office)' path under '2013 CLICK 2 RUN' in article 2019235.

Rule.Name: sBadACEDAO2013C2RWowReg
Rule.Title: Error using Access wizards due incorrect path for Acedao.dll in the registry
Rule.Text: To resolve this issue, update the TypeLib registration for Acedao.dll. Please use the '(64-bit Windows, 32-bit Office)' path under '2013 CLICK 2 RUN' in article 2019235.

Rule.Name: sBadACEDAO2013C2Rx64Reg
Rule.Title: Error using Access wizards due incorrect path for Acedao.dll in the registry
Rule.Text: To resolve this issue, update the TypeLib registration for Acedao.dll. Please use the '(64-bit Windows, 64-bit Office)' path under '2013 CLICK 2 RUN' in article 2019235.

Rule.Name: sBadDAORegAccess32Win64
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion!=11 and $bitness='x86' and $OSDetails_OSArchitecture='x64' and lower-case($sDAOReg)!='%commonprogramfiles%\microsoft shared\dao\dao360.dll' and lower-case($sDAOReg)!='%commonprogramfiles(x86)%\microsoft shared\dao\dao360.dll'
Rule.Title: Registry information related to DAO360.dll is incorrect
Rule.Text: To resolve this issue, you will need to update the TypeLib registration for DAO360.dll. Please use the '64-bit Windows, 32-bit Office' instructions in article 2019235. To open that article, click the 'Click here ...' link.

Rule.Name: sBadDAORegMatchingBitness
Rule.Title: Registry information related to DAO360.dll is incorrect
Rule.Text: To resolve this issue, you will need to update the TypeLib registration for DAO360.dll. Please use the (64-bit Windows, 64-bit Office) or (32-bit Windows, 32-bit Office)' instructions in article 2019235. To open that article, click the 'Click here ...' link.

Rule.Name: sBadAccdbAssoc
Rule.Title: The (Default) value under the HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\.accdb key is set to accdb_auto_file
Rule.Text: When the (Default) value under HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\.accdb key is set to accdb_auto_file, ACCDB files do not open in Access when you double-clicking them. You will need to manually update the registry to fix this problem.

Rule.Name: sACCDBFileAssociation
Rule.Title: The default file association for .accdb files is not correct
Rule.Text: Access is currently not associated as the default application for the following file association (.accdb).

Rule.Name: sACCDEFileAssociation
Rule.Title: The default file association for .accde files is not correct
Rule.Text: Access is currently not associated as the default application for the following file association (.accde).

Rule.Name: sMDBFileAssociation
Rule.Title: The default file association for .mdb files is not correct
Rule.Text: Access is currently not associated as the default application for the following file association (.mdb).

Rule.Name: sMDEFileAssociation
Rule.Title: The default file association for .mde files is not correct
Rule.Text: Access is currently not associated as the default application for the following file association (.mde).

Rule.Name: sHkcuVBAOffPol
Rule.Title: VBA Functionality is impaired or disabled due to Policy under HKCU
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value is set to a value other than 0 as a policy under HKCU. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Rule.Name: sHklmVBAOffPol
Rule.Title: VBA Functionality is impaired or disabled due to Policy under HKLM
Rule.Text: The VBAOff value is set to a value other than 0 as a policy under HKLM. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Object.Name: Application Event Log Entries for Last Access crashes
Object.LogText: Application Event Log Entries for Last Access crashes

Rule.Name: bucketLookup
Rule.Title: Event 1001

Rule.Name: sUnattendedAutomation
Rule.Title: Access is detected to be working in non-user interactive mode through DCOM Settings
Rule.Text: Microsoft does not recommend, nor support, automation of Office applications from any unattended, non-interactive client application or component (including ASP, ASP.NET, DCOM, and NT Services).Please remove the DCOM settings for the Access.

Rule.Name: smscomcltocx12
Rule.Title: Old registry data related to mscomctl.ocx found in the registry
Rule.Text: There is registry data related to mscomctl.ocx that was not removed by a security update. This registry data can cause errors in Access 2007 when the Treeview control is used.

Rule.Name: smscomcltocx14
Rule.Title: Old registry data related to mscomctl.ocx found in the registry
Rule.Text: There is registry data related to mscomctl.ocx that was not removed by a security update. This registry data will cause errors in Access 2010 when the Treeview control is used.
